abstract.value: Abstract   Since its introduction in the 1970s the addition of a complete covering layer over the newly constructed urethra has positively influenced the outcome of hypospadias repairs. Originally applied by Smith during the second stage of a planned 2-stage repair and then to fistula repairs, the de-epithelialized flap has contributed to a marked reduction in post-hypospadias repair complications. The influence of this contribution as well as its application to a variation of the pedicle onlay hypospadias repair is reviewed.

subject: Urology
title: The De-Epithelialized Flap and its Influence on Hypospadias Repair

abstract.value: <jats:p>Because Robert Grosseteste's translation of Aristotle's <jats:italic>Nicomachean Ethics</jats:italic> is now seen as having provided the framework for a dynamic study of Aristotle's moral philosophy, more significance must be attached to what itself became the standard translation in the Middle Ages. That Grosseteste was responsible both for the full translation of Aristotle's text and for the translation of the Greek commentaries which accompany the <jats:italic>Ethics</jats:italic> in twenty-one known manuscripts modern scholars are now in agreement. Grosseteste's work on the <jats:italic>Nicomachean Ethics</jats:italic> has been dated confidently to the 1240s, arguably to 1246â47, and scholars have tended to stress the rapidity with which the Aristotelian ethics were assimilated in the thirteenth century, in contrast, for example, with the slow progress recorded by John of Salisbury on the <jats:italic>Posterior Analytics</jats:italic> in the twelfth. These results of recent research seem, it should be notd in passing, strangely at odds with the verdict of Roger Bacon, that there was comparatively little work on the <jats:italic>Ethics</jats:italic> in his period. He, Grosseteste's most ardent admirer, appears not to have known that this master translated the text and comments: âTardius communicata est Ethica Aristotelis et nuper lecta a magistris et raro.â</jats:p>

subject: Philosophy
Religious studies
Literature and Literary Theory
Visual Arts and Performing Arts
title: Robert Grosseteste as Translator, Transmitter, and Commentator: The âNicomachean Ethicsâ

abstract.value: During the past several years, ASCA has nearly completed mapping of gas temperatures in bright nearby clusters of galaxies. In several clusters, it discovered strong and irregular spatial temperature variations indicative of ongoing violent subcluster mergers. In other systems, the temperature distribution appears symmetric, indicating a relaxed state which is a necessary condition for reliable hydrostatic total mass measurements. I present a (very incomplete) review of these results, discuss their implications for understanding of physical processes in the intracluster gas and for the cluster mass measurements. I also mention some interesting studies that will become possible with the forthcoming Chandra X-ray observatory.

subject: Space and Planetary Science
Astronomy and Astrophysics
title: Cluster gas temperature maps with ASCA and beyond

abstract.value: <jats:title>R\xe9sum\xe9</jats:title><jats:p>Cet article explore les dimensions vari\xe9es du bureau (<jats:italic>office</jats:italic>) professoral comme espace âjuridiqueâ. Dans l'une de ses dimensions, l'office d'un professeur n'est qu'un endroit g\xe9om\xe9trique g\xe9n\xe9rique, sans objectif ou occupant, une potentialit\xe9 formelle. Or, c'est \xe9galement un site dans la mesure que sa localisation, taille et organisation refl\xe8tent une fonctionnalit\xe9âdes valeurs, processus et institutions d\xe9cisionnelles qui d\xe9terminent son occupation. En plus, l'office exprime un r\xf4le et une sc\xe8ne sur laquelle les occupants interagissent avec des coll\xe8gues, des \xe9tudiants, des \xe9trangers de mani\xe8re \xe0 confirmer ou infirmer des relations de pouvoir et de subordination. L'office professoral a aussi une dimension performative dans laquelle la normativit\xe9 d'une communaut\xe9âde professeurs, employ\xe9s et \xe9tudiantsâest imagin\xe9e et agie. Par ailleurs, dans une autre dimension, il s'agit d'un espace rituel o\xf9 des professeurs travaillent, se d\xe9tendent, r\xe9fl\xe9chissent et contemplent r\xe9flexivement des mod\xe8les et formes de pens\xe9es. Un tel office existe o\xf9 que ses occupants choisissent de le tenir. Finalement, l'office est un non-lieu de d\xe9couverte personnelleâl'indication d'un espace qui n'est que dans les relations qu'il cr\xe9e et qui le cr\xe9ent.</jats:p>

In the late 1980s one of us wrote a paper entitled 'Office Politics' for the Law and Leviathan symposium sponsored by the Law Reform Commission of Canada. The paper was the lead contribution to a panel addressing 'Normative order in the administrative state.' Conceived as a parable, the paper was composed as an exchange of memos among a dean and several professors in a law faculty about how offices should be allocated in an environment dominated by scarcity and non-substitutability of goods. While the terrain of inquiry thus evoked distributive justice, the primary ambition of the paper was to explore the complexities of normativity, and in particular what might be called 'implicit and inferential normativity' in organizations and public institutions.

subject: Sociology and Political Science
Law
title: Office Politics (Again)!.

abstract.value: Cationic polyacrylamides (c-PAMs) bind to starch granules and decrease the temperature for the onset of gelatinization by 8\xc2\xb0C. c-PAM increases the binding of \xce\xb1-amylase to cornstarch; the rate of cornstarch hydrolysis also increases. By analogy to previous work on the c-PAM promoted hydrolysis of cellulose, it is proposed that the polymer reduces the charge on the surface of starch through a charge-patch mechanism. Because both enzyme and substrate are negatively charged, the bound c-PAM reduces the charge repulsion experienced by the approaching enzyme, which leads to stronger enzyme-substrate binding and faster hydrolysis. Overall, the c-PAM reduces enzyme dose by up to 62% under the conditions used. There is a mirror image relationship between the viscosity of the medium and the hydrolysis rate, which allows optimization of these parameters with enzyme and c-PAM dosage. Low c-PAM levels increase viscosity by agglomerating the substrate, but the viscosity drops at higher c-PAM concentration. \xc2\xa9 2012 American Institute of Chemical Engineers AIChE J, 59: 79\xe2\x80\x9383, 2013

abstract.value: I would make several comments on Sol Yurick's article, "The Political Economy of Junk," in the December 1970 MR. I have no quarrel with his basic thesis that the current spread of, and alarm over, drug addiction must be viewed in the context of the political and economic system from which it springs. I think, though, that Mr. Yurick depicts its genesis too much as a conscious, deliberate act of Nixon or "the ruling class." Furthermore I think he tends to oversimplify or overemphasize the impacts on the legal and illicit subeconomies which addiction affects. This article can also be found at the   Monthly Review  website , where most recent articles are published in full.   Click here to purchase a PDF version of this article at the  Monthly Review  website.

title: Response to Sol Yurick's "Political Economy of Junk"; Response to a Response

abstract.value:
For the pair (A,B), where A is a differential operator and B is a boundary operator in sections of bundles over the manifold M with boundary \xce\x93, one indicates the construction of a complex of sheaves of germs of sections of the bundles Ei, over M and Gi over \xce\x93 and of differential-boundary operators

$$\\underset{\\raise0.3em\\hbox{$\\smash{\\scriptscriptstyle-}$}}{E} _o \\xrightarrow{{(A, B)}} \\underset{\\raise0.3em\\hbox{$\\smash{\\scriptscriptstyle-}$}}{E} _1 \\times \\underset{\\raise0.3em\\hbox{$\\smash{\\scriptscriptstyle-}$}}{G} _1 \\to \\underset{\\raise0.3em\\hbox{$\\smash{\\scriptscriptstyle-}$}}{E} _2 \\times \\underset{\\raise0.3em\\hbox{$\\smash{\\scriptscriptstyle-}$}}{G} _2 \\to \\ldots \\to 0 .$$

In the real analytic case the cohomology of this complex in the termE 1 \xc3\x97G 1 is equal to zero (the local solvability of the boundary value problem under the compatibility conditions) if the conormal to the boundary \xce\x93 is in the direction of the least degeneracy of the symbol of the operator A, while the complex is exact if the degeneracy of the symbol is the same in all directions (for example, if A is elliptic).

subject: Statistics and Probability
Applied Mathematics

title: Formal properties of boundary-value problems for overdetermined systems of partial differential equations
